case_study.name: Case Study (CS)
case_study.description: A case study (Written Assessment) consists of scenarios that allow an assessment of the candidate's mastery of abilities. The assessor can collect process evidence to assess the candidate's competencies against the learning outcomes. It allows consistent interpretation of evidence and reliable assessment outcomes.
case_study.focus: This case study assessment focuses on providing authentic evidence of candidates' ability to apply security risk analysis techniques to assess and address security risks in various scenarios.

evidence.LO1: Candidates will submit a report demonstrating their application of basic risk identification techniques based on provided scenarios.
evidence.LO2: Candidates will submit a report outlining their adherence to organizational procedures in identifying risks related to surveillance or inappropriate behavior.
evidence.LO3: Candidates will submit an analysis of provided situations, relating them to prior experiences to identify potential threats or suspicious activities.
evidence.LO4: Candidates will submit a collaborative risk assessment report, demonstrating the use of established methods of risk analysis within a team setting.

submission: Candidates will submit their case study reports and any additional supporting documents to the assessors electronically via the designated learning management system.
case_study.retention_period: All submitted case study reports and accompanying documentation will be retained for 3 years to ensure compliance with institutional policies and for auditing purposes.

oral_questioning.name: Oral Questioning (OQ)
oral_questioning.description: Oral Questioning assessments allow candidates to demonstrate their understanding of concepts through verbal responses, focusing on the practical application of security risk analysis.

evidence.LO1: Assessors will ask questions to gauge the candidate's understanding of risk identification techniques.
evidence.LO2: Assessors will ask questions to evaluate the candidate's knowledge of organizational procedures for risk identification.
evidence.LO3: Assessors will ask questions to examine the candidate's ability to analyze situations and identify suspicious activities.
evidence.LO4: Assessors will ask questions to determine the candidate's understanding of collaborative risk assessment methods.

submission: Candidates will verbally respond to assessors during a structured questioning session.
oral_questioning.retention_period: All oral questioning recordings and assessment notes will be retained for 2 years for compliance and auditing.
